items.title: How Canada Is Dealing With Its Latest Tussle With President Trump
items.summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney is focusing on what the country can control, including looking for economic partnerships abroad, especially in Asia.

items.title: Food Banks in U.S. Brace for Surging Demand as SNAP Aid Cutoff Looms
items.summary: Growing need and decreased resources are squeezing the charitable food system beyond its capacity, leaders say.

items.title: Trump, Long Erratic on the World Stage, Reaches a New Level
items.summary: Whether because of his increasingly mercurial approach or despite it, President Trump has won some foreign policy victories in his second term. The question now is whether he can build on his record.

items.title: Newsom Says He Will Consider a 2028 Presidential Run After the Midterms
items.summary: The California governor acknowledged in an interview Sunday on CBS that he would give the question serious thought after the 2026 elections.

items.title: ‘No Idea How Long People Can Hold Out’: Federal Workers Feel Brunt of Shutdown
items.summary: As more than one million government employees go without pay, many are turning to side jobs and food banks to make ends meet.

items.title: Trump and Xi Could ‘Consummate’ TikTok Deal This Week, Bessent Says
items.summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on “Face the Nation” on Sunday that China and the United States had reached “a final deal on TikTok,” but offered few details.

items.title: Trump news at a glance: administration accused of attack on free speech after British journalist detained
items.summary: <p>Homeland security said Hamdi’s visa had been revoked amid claims the move was apparent retaliation for his criticism of Israel. Key US politics stories from Sunday 26 October at a glance</p><p>The council of American-Islamic relations (Cair) has accused the Trump administration of a “blatant affront to free speech” after federal immigration authorities detained British journalist, Sami Hamdi, on Sunday.</p><p>The Muslim civil rights organization claimed that Hamdi had been detained at San Fransisco airport for criticising Israel’s ongoing military campaign in Gaza. Hamdi is one of several people who have been arrested and deported by ICE for expressing pro-Palestinian views.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/27/trump-administration-news-updates-today-latest">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: US and China agree ‘framework’ for trade deal ahead of Xi-Trump meeting
items.summary: <p>US treasury secretary anticipates tariff truce with China will be extended, and that China will revive substantial purchases of US soybeans</p><p>The US and China have agreed a framework for a trade deal just days before Donald Trump and Chines president Xi Jinping are due to meet.</p><p>Treasury secretary Scott Bessent said the agreement, forged on the sidelines of the Association of south-east Asian Nations (Asean) summit in Malaysia on Sunday, would remove the threat of the imposition of 100% tariffs on Chinese imports starting on 1 November and include “a final deal” on the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2025/oct/26/us-china-tiktok-deal-scott-bessent">sale of TikTok in the US.</a></p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/27/us-china-framework-trade-deal-xi-trump-meeting">Continue reading...</a>
